recommended_treatment: Systemic therapy ± external beam pelvic radiotherapy ± vaginal brachytherapy
description: Surgical pathology demonstrated a primary endometrioid adenocarcinoma with superficial myometrial invasion and fallopian tube involvement without lymphovascular or cervical stromal invasion.
patient_notes: Your report shows a cancer originating in the lining of the uterus that extended slightly into the uterine muscle and involved the fallopian tube but not lymph nodes or other organs. Based on current guidelines, we recommend chemotherapy with radiation therapy, including possible vaginal brachytherapy, to lower the risk of recurrence.

verification.assessment: FIGO stage IIIA (pT3a N0 M0) is accurate based on adnexal (fallopian tube) involvement without lymphovascular invasion; adjuvant therapy should include systemic chemotherapy with optional pelvic EBRT and vaginal brachytherapy per NCCN guidelines.

recommended_treatment.issues: Contains placeholder null characters inconsistent with NCCN guideline terminology
